column4: i need a software similiar to dvdflick which can take avi file, convert it and burn it to dvd file...is there one for ubuntu?
guys..what software u use to convert and burn avi to dvd?
it is in the repos but there is a very latest on the maker'S site that lets you make simple menues
you can dl the pacakge at the bottom of the page,simple enough
the devede 3.2 pacakge and hold on
vocx  the bug is with mencoder
the first two packages is what you need
which i should install first...devede or the mplayer/mencoder?
those aren'T regular install files if you need help let me know
right now futsy is in beta , stick t fiesty
are you short on  hdd space ?
i extracted the devede file, and run the install.sh under root...so where it is installed and how to run the app?
you should get a menu entry in sound/video if not  the command is devede
it is possible that the entry just didnT' update you can make one later using main menu in the prefs menu ,  for now you can start it with alt_f2   just type devede
did you install devede or are you still trying to ?
